intro: Nenax arenicola, commonly known as the sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to arid environments. Nenax arenicola is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of desert scrub habitats.
